header: Millions of students have tried the Hour of Code™
students: in the UK have tried an
feedback_title: The Hour of Code had almost 40 million participants in the United States, with overwhelming feedback from students, teachers, and parents.
feedback_1: "I saw fireworks go off over students' heads, not lightbulbs." - Teacher
feedback_2: "Best educational product I’ve ever come across." - Parent/entrepreneur
feedback_3: "I have NEVER, EVER seen my students so excited about learning." - Teacher
feedback_4: "One of the two best things that happened in 2013." - 2nd grader
feedback_5: "And then I knew that this was like a once in a lifetime chance to learn this." - 5th grader
feedback_6: "Now I’m trying to tell other schools to teach code because it really was an amazing experience." - 5th grader
feedback_7: "The kids were excited and a few obsessed." - Teacher
feedback_8: "Today, they ran into my room before class even began and asked if they could start. I was overwhelmed with their excitement and curiosity in coding." - Teacher
feedback_9: "My 3 kids came home from school yesterday yelling about the Hour of Code. My six-year-old instructing me on how to program Angry Birds, my 10-year-old boy proclaiming 'I am going to be a software engineer. It is the job I was made for. It is my DESTINY!'" - Parent
leaders: Leaders and trendsetters agree more students should learn computer science
